testproblem.name: NoNormalFlow_DG

variables.variable: from fluidity_tools import stat_parser s=stat_parser("No_normal_flow.stat") stats={} stats["UCrossMax"]=s["Water"]["VelocityCrossStream"]["max"][-1] stats["UL2"]=s["Water"]["Velocity%magnitude"]["l2norm"][-1] stats["UConstant"]=s["Water"]["Velocity%magnitude"]["max"][-1]-s["Water"]["Velocity%magnitude"]["min"][-1]

pass_tests.test: assert(stats["UConstant"]<2.5e-3)Check that the velocity in the domain is constant. This is part of the check that no drag is introduced ad the domain edges.
assert(stats["UCrossMax"]<6.e-4)Check that the velocity in the cross-stream direction is really zero. This checks that the boundaries are really leak-proof.
assert(abs(stats["UL2"]-2.0)<1.e-2)Check that the L2Norm of the velocity is correct. This is another check that there is no drag imposed.

testproblem.comment: This problem tests a spatially constant flow through a channel at 45 degrees to the axes with free slip boundary conditions. The channel is periodic and the flow is driven by a sponge region near the periodic boundary. The flow should converge on a constant velocity of sqrt(2) along the channel.
